meanings.definition: To eat something quickly and noisily
meanings.sent1: The hungry child would gobble up his food in seconds.
meanings.sent2: She watched the birds gobble the seeds in the garden.
meanings.sent3: The raccoon tried to gobble the cookies left on the table.
meanings.sent4: The vacuum cleaner seemed to gobble everything in its path.
meanings.sent5: The wolf would gobble down its prey without hesitation.

meanings.definition: The sound made by a turkey
meanings.sent1: We heard the gobble of the turkey from the farm nearby.
meanings.sent2: The loud gobble echoed through the forest on Thanksgiving.
meanings.sent3: The funny gobble of the turkey made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The gobble of the turkey signaled the start of the holiday feast.
meanings.sent5: The distinct gobble of the turkey filled the air with anticipation.

meanings.sent1: She would gobble about her day as soon as she got home.
meanings.sent2: The children would gobble with excitement about the upcoming trip.
meanings.sent3: The friends would gobble about the latest gossip in town.
meanings.sent4: The auctioneer would gobble the prices of the items at lightning speed.
meanings.sent5: The teacher would gobble the instructions for the science experiment.
